::: {style="text-align: center;"}
# Estimation
:::

----

* Want to test: Disemployment impacts $\SIMNeg$ HHI

1. First stage: $w^{M}$ &rArr; $y_{jmt}$ (mean earnings), MW earnings elasticity $b$ at  

. . .

::: {.description-list}
**a. Market $m$ level** [@AzaretalRESTUD2024, n=56K-57K]
: Compute&use market $m$ mean of each year $t$  

**b. Establishment $j$ level** of market $m$
: Compute&use establishment $j$ mean of market $m$ of each year $t$

**c. Individual $i$ level** of establishment $j$, market $m$
: Use individual $i$ earning of establishment $m$, market $m$ of each year $t$
:::

. . .

2. Second stage: $w^{M}$ &rArr; $L_{mt}$ (employment), MW employment elasticity $\beta+\delta$ at  

. . . 

::: {.description-list}
**a. Market $m$ level**  

**b. Establishment $j$ level of market $m$**
:::

----

@AzaretalRESTUD2024  

* Use General Merchandise sector's stock clerks and order fillers (SOC 43-5081), retail salespersons (SOC 41-2031), and cachers (SOC 41-2011) in Burning Glass data, 2010q1-2016q4
   * Use all county-quarter obs with at least 2 obs in Table 2
   * Restricting to all county-quarter obs with at least 8 obs in their Table A7 (n=47K-56K)
* "Labour market" = occupation by county $i$
   * Estimate separately by occupation
   * $HHI_{mt}$ of market $m$ (occupation (SOC-6) level by county for all posters of all industries) in quarter $t$  
   * Citing @Schubertetal2024, job switches are stable at 6 digit level occupation code  

----

@AzaretalRESTUD2024  

* Use mean $\overline{HHI}_{m}$ of $HHI_{mt}$ for all $t$ as concentration measure
   * Endogeneity? OK, because $\corr[HHI_{mt}, w^{M}]\simeq 0$ and robust to using only pre-period $\overline{HHI}_{m}$
* Also use a binary low/high concentration: $HHI^{h}=1$ if $\overline{HHI}_{m}>.25$

----

::: {style="font-size: 80%;line-height: 1.1;"}
$$
\begin{aligned}
\ln Y_{it} &= \alpha + {\color{red}\beta} \ln w^{M}_{it} + {\color{red}\psi} HHI_{i} + {\color{red}\delta} \ln w^{M}_{it}*HHI_{i}\\
&\hspace{2em} + \overbrace{\zeta \ln TotEarnings_{it}}^{\mbox{productivity proxy}}+ \overbrace{\phi \ln TotEmployed_{it} + \eta \ln Pop_{it}+ \tau_{t}\ln Unemp_{it}}^{\mbox{market level heterogenous trends}} \\
&\hspace{2em} + \gamma_{i} + \tau_{ct} + \chi I_{s}t.
\end{aligned}
$$

$Y_{it}$: Employment of county $i$ in quarter $t$  

$\tau_{ct}$: census division specific quarter fixed effects  

$\chi$: state specific linear trends

Clustering at state level
:::

* $\delta>0$ in @AzaretalRESTUD2024, Table 2
* $\beta<0$ only when HHI is added
   * $\beta=0$ when HHI is not added as a covariate (Table A3)

----

Our specification 1, aligned to @AzaretalRESTUD2024

$$
\begin{aligned}
\ln Y_{jt} &= \alpha_{t} + \beta_{t} \ln w^{M}_{t} + \psi HHI_{i} + \delta_{t} \ln w^{M}_{t}*HHI_{i}\\
&\hspace{2em}  + \zeta \ln TotEarnings_{it}\\
&\hspace{2em} + \phi \ln TotEmployed_{it} + \eta \ln Pop_{it}+ \tau_{t}\ln Unemp_{it}\\
&\hspace{2em} + \gamma_{i}  + \not{\tau_{it}} + \chi I_{s}t + \epsilon_{it}.
\end{aligned}
$$

$\tau_{it}$: market-by-year fixed effects needs to be dropped, due to collinearity with $\ln w^{M}_{t}*HHI_{i}$

----

Our specification 2, aligned to @HarasztosiLindner2019

$$
\% \mbox{ change in }Y_{jt} = \alpha_{t}+\beta_{t}FA_{j}+\psi HHI_{i} + \delta_{t} FA_{j}*HHI_{i}+\bfgamma'\bfx_{it}+\epsilon_{it}.
$$

More in detail

$$
\begin{aligned}
\frac{Y_{jt}-Y_{j2012}}{Y_{j2012}} &= \alpha_{t} + \beta_{t} FA_{j} + \psi HHI_{i} + \delta_{t} FA_{j}*HHI_{i}\\
&\hspace{2em}  + \zeta \ln TotEarnings_{it}\\
&\hspace{2em} + \phi \ln TotEmployed_{it} + \eta \ln Pop_{it}+ \tau_{t}\ln Unemp_{it}\\
&\hspace{2em} + \gamma_{i}  + \chi I_{s}t + \epsilon_{it}.
\end{aligned}
$$

----

Other specifications in @AzaretalRESTUD2024

* Heterogenous impacts by sequentially adding covariates of "market level heterogenous trends" (Table 5)
* Wage distribution change below/above $w^{M}$: Bunching design of @Cengiz2019
* $w^{M}$+$HHI$+$w^{M}*HHI_{i}$ &rArr; output prices [local (CBSA) all items CPI subcategory (Table A19), commodities CPI subcategory  (Table A20)]


----

Placebo tests

* Use other sector firms/workers with no minimum wage workers
   * Finance, dentists, accounting, consulting?
   * By occupation: Physicians' offices, registered nurses, medical assistants, vocational nurses, medical accountant-auditor, accounting, tax preparation, book keeping, payroll service providers [@AzaretalRESTUD2024, Table A]   
* Use pre-period observations
   * Only 2 years are used in Kilumelume et al. (2024). Can use a separare sample that extends backwards, which is used only for placebo testing because the attrition rate is high.

# Task implementation and communications
:::

----

Main analysis data

**IRP5-HHI**

* IRP5/Job level/v5/beta/IRP5_20YY_cleaned.dta, 2008-2022 &rarr; HHI
* HHIs are computed at main place, local municipality, district, province levels, by 
   * low/high wage
   * seasonal/non-seasonal jobs: `periodemployedfrom`, `periodemployedto`
   * gender: `gender`
   * age group: `dateofbirth`
   * Need more South African elements.

**CIT-IRP5 (Michael's estimation data)**

* CIT-IRP5/v5 with SIC7 2 digits = 11-16, available 2008-2022 but use 2011-2018/2021
* Replicated by Noreen
